SetupDetails.QuestDesc: Rescue the prisoner atop the shipwreck in Bwala ya Masa.

Precondition.Name: True Only Once Flag
Precondition.Description: Combines the Check Flag precondition with a Set Flag operation on the same identifier. Checks whether a string identifier has been flagged. If not, this precondition will return true AND flag the identifier. Thus, this precondition will only be fulfilled once, unless the flag is manually unset.
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: if not qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] then qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] = true return true end return false

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Set Route
Operation.Description:
Immediately sets the patrol route of a specific Game Object. Compatible with Soldiers, Helicopters, UAVs and Prisoners. Soldiers and Helicopters will transition back to their defined sneak/caution route when prompted by their command post. UAVs and Prisoners will retain this route across both sneak and caution phases.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - This operation will set Prisoners to a walkable state (not force-scared, force-downed, or unlocked). Untied prisoners will become tied again.

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The soldier/helicopter/UAV/Prisoner (their name or GameObjectId) to be re-routed

Choice.Name: New Route
Choice.Description: The name of the route that the target Game Object will begin to patrol.

Operation.Name: Start Hidden Timer
Operation.Description: Begins a background countdown that sends a Timer -> "Start" and Timer -> "Finish" event. This can be used for chaining events together on a delay, or creating a delayed event loop. The name of the timer is the sender of the event.

Choice.Name: Sender
Choice.Description: The name of the timer. When the timer is finished, an event will occur. You can catch that event By creating a new script with a "Timer" StrCode, "Finish" message, and this value as the "Sender".

Choice.Name: Duration (Seconds)
Choice.Description: The number of seconds that the timer will count to before triggering the "Finish" event.

Precondition.Name: Always True
Precondition.Description:
Empty Precondition.
- Always returns true (same as having no preconditions at all).
This particular precondition is baked into SOC, but the other precondition templates are saved as xml files in the Scriptal Library folder. Open the ScriptAssets folder to view and create custom scriptal templates for the library.

Operation.Name: Play Generic Radio Call
Operation.Description: Immediately plays a radio call from a radio group ID. Notes on english dialogue for the group ids can be found here: https://mgsvmoddingwiki.github.io/RadioIDToEnglishVoice/

Choice.Name: Radio Preset
Choice.Description: The radio group ID that will be played over the radio. Wrapped in a variable to provide context.

Precondition.Name: Always True
Precondition.Description:
Empty Precondition.
- Always returns true (same as having no preconditions at all).
This particular precondition is baked into SOC, but the other precondition templates are saved as xml files in the Scriptal Library folder. Open the ScriptAssets folder to view and create custom scriptal templates for the library.

Operation.Name: Set Flag
Operation.Description: Flags an identifier. If the identifier is already flagged, this does nothing.

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Precondition.Name: Check GameObjectId
Precondition.Description:
Checks to see if a number matches a GameObjectId. Comparing a GameObjectId to the Event Default Argument 'arg1' is similar to checking the Sender.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - Other event args can contain GameIds, check Tex's notes on messages in InfLookup.lua for more details: https://github.com/TinManTex/InfiniteHeaven/blob/master/tpp/gamedir-ih/GameDir/mod/modules/InfLookup.lua
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempGameObjectIdVal = |[1|STRING,NUMBER]| if type(tempGameObjectIdVal) == "string" then tempGameObjectIdVal = GetGameObjectId(tempGameObjectIdVal) end return tempGameObjectIdVal == |[2|NUMBER]|

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The Game Object (their string name or number GameObjectId) to be compared against.

Choice.Name: Number ID
Choice.Description: The ID to compare to the GameObjectId

Operation.Name: Start Hidden Timer
Operation.Description: Begins a background countdown that sends a Timer -> "Start" and Timer -> "Finish" event. This can be used for chaining events together on a delay, or creating a delayed event loop. The name of the timer is the sender of the event.

Choice.Name: Sender
Choice.Description: The name of the timer. When the timer is finished, an event will occur. You can catch that event By creating a new script with a "Timer" StrCode, "Finish" message, and this value as the "Sender".

Choice.Name: Duration (Seconds)
Choice.Description: The number of seconds that the timer will count to before triggering the "Finish" event.

Precondition.Name: Check Game Object Id
Precondition.Description:
Checks to see if a number matches a GameObjectId. Handy for checking event arguments. This is the go-to method of checking if a game object is involved in an event, and much more reliable than filtering events with Senders.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. - For GeoTraps and some Player messages, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - Check Tex's notes on messages in InfLookup.lua for more details: https://github.com/TinManTex/InfiniteHeaven/blob/master/tpp/gamedir-ih/GameDir/mod/modules/InfLookup.lua
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempGameObjectIdVal = |[1|STRING,NUMBER]| if type(tempGameObjectIdVal) == "string" then tempGameObjectIdVal = GetGameObjectId(tempGameObjectIdVal) end return tempGameObjectIdVal == |[2|NUMBER]|

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The Game Object (their string name or number GameObjectId) to be compared against.

Choice.Name: Game Object ID
Choice.Description: The ID to compare against the game object. The precondition is fulfilled if they match.

Precondition.Name: True Only Once Flag
Precondition.Description: Combines the Check Flag precondition with a Set Flag operation on the same identifier. Checks whether a string identifier has been flagged. If not, this precondition will return true AND flag the identifier. Thus, this precondition will only be fulfilled once, unless the flag is manually unset.
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: if not qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] then qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] = true return true end return false

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Play Generic Radio Call
Operation.Description: Immediately plays a radio call from a radio group ID. Notes on english dialogue for the group ids can be found here: https://mgsvmoddingwiki.github.io/RadioIDToEnglishVoice/

Choice.Name: Radio Preset
Choice.Description: The radio group ID that will be played over the radio. Wrapped in a variable to provide context.

Operation.Name: Call Heli To LZ Near Player
Operation.Description: Calls a support helicopter to an LZ to wait for the player. The Helicopter will be routed to the LZ closest to the current position of the player.
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempPlayerPos = TppPlayer.GetPosition() GameObject.SendCommand( GameObject.GetGameObjectId( "TppHeli2", "SupportHeli" ), { id = "CallToLandingZoneAtPosition", position = Vector3(tempPlayerPos[1], tempPlayerPos[2], tempPlayerPos[3]) } ) GameObject.SendCommand( GameObject.GetGameObjectId( "TppHeli2", "SupportHeli" ), { id = "SetTakeOffWaitTime", time = |[2|NUMBER]| } )

Choice.Name: Wait For Player Duration
Choice.Description: Once the helicopter arrives, wait at the LZ before deciding that the player is a no-show and leaving (in minutes). Set to 0 to wait forever.

Precondition.Name: True Only Once Flag
Precondition.Description: Combines the Check Flag precondition with a Set Flag operation on the same identifier. Checks whether a string identifier has been flagged. If not, this precondition will return true AND flag the identifier. Thus, this precondition will only be fulfilled once, unless the flag is manually unset.
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: if not qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] then qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] = true return true end return false

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Mark As Target
Operation.Description:
Displays a Quest Target marker on the Game Object. Accepts both GameObjectIds and GameObject Names.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - This operation is purely visual and does not handle actual target logic.
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempGameObjectIdVal = |[1|STRING,NUMBER]| if type(tempGameObjectIdVal) == "string" then tempGameObjectIdVal = GetGameObjectId(tempGameObjectIdVal) end TppMarker.EnableQuestTargetMarker(tempGameObjectIdVal) TppSoundDaemon.PostEvent"sfx_s_enemytag_quest_tgt"

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The soldier, hostage, etc. to be visually marked as the target.

Operation.Name: Play Generic Radio Call
Operation.Description: Immediately plays a radio call from a radio group ID. Notes on english dialogue for the group ids can be found here: https://mgsvmoddingwiki.github.io/RadioIDToEnglishVoice/

Choice.Name: Radio Preset
Choice.Description: The radio group ID that will be played over the radio. Wrapped in a variable to provide context.

Precondition.Name: Always True
Precondition.Description:
Empty Precondition.
- Always returns true (same as having no preconditions at all).
This particular precondition is baked into SOC, but the other precondition templates are saved as xml files in the Scriptal Library folder. Open the ScriptAssets folder to view and create custom scriptal templates for the library.

Operation.Name: Set Route
Operation.Description:
Immediately sets the patrol route of a specific Game Object. Compatible with Soldiers, Helicopters, UAVs and Prisoners. Soldiers and Helicopters will transition back to their defined sneak/caution route when prompted by their command post. UAVs and Prisoners will retain this route across both sneak and caution phases.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - This operation will set Prisoners to a walkable state (not force-scared, force-downed, or unlocked). Untied prisoners will become tied again.

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The soldier/helicopter/UAV/Prisoner (their name or GameObjectId) to be re-routed

Choice.Name: New Route
Choice.Description: The name of the route that the target Game Object will begin to patrol.

Precondition.Name: Check GameObjectId
Precondition.Description:
Checks to see if a number matches a GameObjectId. Comparing a GameObjectId to the Event Default Argument 'arg1' is similar to checking the Sender.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - Other event args can contain GameIds, check Tex's notes on messages in InfLookup.lua for more details: https://github.com/TinManTex/InfiniteHeaven/blob/master/tpp/gamedir-ih/GameDir/mod/modules/InfLookup.lua
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempGameObjectIdVal = |[1|STRING,NUMBER]| if type(tempGameObjectIdVal) == "string" then tempGameObjectIdVal = GetGameObjectId(tempGameObjectIdVal) end return tempGameObjectIdVal == |[2|NUMBER]|

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The Game Object (their string name or number GameObjectId) to be compared against.

Choice.Name: Number ID
Choice.Description: The ID to compare to the GameObjectId

Precondition.Name: True Only Once Flag
Precondition.Description: Combines the Check Flag precondition with a Set Flag operation on the same identifier. Checks whether a string identifier has been flagged. If not, this precondition will return true AND flag the identifier. Thus, this precondition will only be fulfilled once, unless the flag is manually unset.
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: if not qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] then qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] = true return true end return false

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Set Sneak Route
Operation.Description:
Updates the route that the NPC patrols while out of the caution phase. Compatible with soldiers, helicopters and prisoners. Prisoners will retain this route across both sneak and caution phases.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - This operation does not reset prisoners to a walkable state (not force-scared, force-downed, or unlocked). Using the "Set Route" operation instead is recommended for prisoners.
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempGameObjectIdVal = |[1|STRING,NUMBER]| if type(tempGameObjectIdVal) == "string" then tempGameObjectIdVal = GetGameObjectId(tempGameObjectIdVal) end local tempGameObjectCommand = { id = "SetSneakRoute", route = |[2|STRING]| } GameObject.SendCommand(tempGameObjectIdVal, tempGameObjectCommand)

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The soldier/helicopter/prisoner (their name or GameObjectId) to be re-routed

Choice.Name: Sneak Route
Choice.Description: The name of the route that the NPC will patrol during the sneak phase.

Operation.Name: Set Flag
Operation.Description: Flags an identifier. If the identifier is already flagged, this does nothing.

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Play Generic Radio Call
Operation.Description: Immediately plays a radio call from a radio group ID. Notes on english dialogue for the group ids can be found here: https://mgsvmoddingwiki.github.io/RadioIDToEnglishVoice/

Choice.Name: Radio Preset
Choice.Description: The radio group ID that will be played over the radio. Wrapped in a variable to provide context.
